meanings.definition: To control or operate by means of a computer or computerized system.
meanings.sent1: I cybernate my smart home system to turn off the lights remotely.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to cybernate their inventory management for better efficiency.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally cybernated my alarm clock to go off at midnight instead of 7 AM!
meanings.sent4: She cybernated her schedule to fit in more activities, like a digital magician.
meanings.sent5: The scientist cybernated the robot to perform complex tasks with precision.

meanings.definition: To manage or control a system or process using computer technology.
meanings.sent1: The IT specialist will cybernate the new network setup for optimal performance.
meanings.sent2: It is essential to cybernate the security measures to protect sensitive data.
meanings.sent3: I tried to cybernate my morning routine, but ended up with breakfast for dinner!
meanings.sent4: The team cybernated the project timeline to meet the deadline, like digital wizards.
meanings.sent5: He cybernated the simulation to test different scenarios efficiently.
